attributes.action: Regulate coal prices for domestic consumers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Coal prices in the UK have risen by 80% since September 2008. The government has no fixed price agreements with the British coal industry. They are effectively allowed to charge what they like to domestic consumers, and this week they intend to increase their prices a further 10%. 

Given that oil prices have gone down, will the government please bring into force price regulations on coal to prevent families from freezing to death and being driven into poverty.
